info.author: Jim Pharis
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: GNU General Public License (GPL)
info.description:
OpenSesame
==========
OpenSesame is an open source password management tool designed to be secure and
easy to use. The fewer key strokes the better. OpenSesame uses GNOME-keyring to
store and retrieve generated passwords. Passwords are generated using APG 
(Automated Password Generator) so that the passwords are easy to remember. To
retrieve a password you only need to remember the name the password was stored
as. For example, run OpenSesame and enter 'twitter' to place your twitter pass-
word into the cntl-v paste buffer.

Dependencies
============
python2.7 xdotool python-keybinder python-cairo apg python-wnck
info.name: OpenSesame
info.summary: Password management made simple and secure in GNOME
info.html_description:
OpenSesame

OpenSesame is an open source password management tool designed to be secure and easy to use. The fewer key strokes the better. OpenSesame uses GNOME-keyring to store and retrieve generated passwords. Passwords are generated using APG (Automated Password Generator) so that the passwords are easy to remember. To retrieve a password you only need to remember the name the password was stored as. For example, run OpenSesame and enter ‘twitter’ to place your twitter pass- word into the cntl-v paste buffer.

Dependencies

python2.7 xdotool python-keybinder python-cairo apg python-wnck
